vulnerability_findings.name: use-ownable2step
vulnerability_findings.message: By demanding that the receiver of the owner permissions actively accept via a contract call of its own,  `Ownable2Step` and `Ownable2StepUpgradeable` prevent the contract ownership from accidentally being transferred  to an address that cannot handle it.

vulnerability_findings.name: init-variables-with-default-value
vulnerability_findings.message: Uninitialized variables are assigned with the types default value. Explicitly initializing a variable with its default value costs unnecessary gas.

vulnerability_findings.name: pragma
vulnerability_findings.message:
Different versions of Solidity is used in CappedToken.sol:
	- Version used: ['^0.4.11', '^0.4.18']
	- CappedToken.sol#3 declares pragma solidity^0.4.18
	- CappedToken.sol#20 declares pragma solidity^0.4.18
	- CappedToken.sol#71 declares pragma solidity^0.4.18
	- CappedToken.sol#121 declares pragma solidity^0.4.18
	- CappedToken.sol#136 declares pragma solidity^0.4.18
	- CappedToken.sol#236 declares pragma solidity^0.4.18
	- CappedToken.sol#281 declares pragma solidity^0.4.18
	- CappedToken.sol#329 declares pragma solidity^0.4.11

vulnerability_findings.name: solc-version
vulnerability_findings.message:
Detected issues with version pragma in CappedToken.sol:
	- pragma solidity^0.4.18 (CappedToken.sol#3): it allows old versions
	- pragma solidity^0.4.18 (CappedToken.sol#20): it allows old versions
	- pragma solidity^0.4.18 (CappedToken.sol#71): it allows old versions
	- pragma solidity^0.4.18 (CappedToken.sol#121): it allows old versions

	- pragma solidity^0.4.18 (CappedToken.sol#281): it allows old versions
	- pragma solidity^0.4.11 (CappedToken.sol#329): it allows old versions
